Description: Yellow jasper rectangular plaque, longitudinally pierced, one side inscribed with prenomen of Amenhotep II and the hieroglyphs men-ib `steadfast of heart' and decorated with a representation of a bull, other side inscribed with hieroglyphs comprising the name of Amun and the words aa `great' hem `majesty' and qenef `he is strong' and decorated with a representation of a horse.
Bibliographic references: Curtis & Tallis 2012 / The Horse from Arabia to Ascot (10)
Exhibition history: 2010 01 Jun-31 Dec, USA, Kentucky Horse Park, International Museum of the Horse, 'A Gift from the Desert' 2012 24 May - 30 Sep, London, BM 'The horse:from Arabia to Royal Ascot' 2015-2017, June - ?, International Touring Exhibition, The Horse in Art & History 2021-2022 16 Sept-9 Jan, Budapest, Museum of Fine Arts, The discovery of the Pharaoh's tomb, Amenhotep II and his time
Acquisition name: Donated by: Léon Jean Joseph Dubois
